executive_summary: Over the five years to 2022, the Dishwasher Manufacturing industry has benefited from an expanding economy and new, higher-margin smart dishwashers. Demand has been underpinned by an increase in rising per capita disposable income during the period. Conversely, rising imports and falling exports have suppressed growth in industry revenue. As a result, domestic manufacturers have fulfilled a decreasing share of domestic demand for dishwashers. Over the five years to 2022, industry revenue is expected to increase at an annualized rate of 3.2% to $2.5 billion, including a 0.1% increase in 2022.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The COVID-19 pandemic fueled industry growth, with government aid inflating per capita disposable income and low mortgage rates boosting residential construction. However, profit suffered amid soaring input prices like steel.
Demand for smart dishwashers supported revenue growth. But rising imports and falling exports suppressed growth. Profit plunged due to soaring input costs like steel prices.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry will expand smart dishwasher production as technology becomes more affordable. Smart dishwashers can interact with smart power grids and connect to smartphones.
A declining US dollar is expected to boost exports as domestic goods become cheaper for foreign buyers. Imports are projected to fall as a share of domestic demand.
Sluggish residential construction and home improvement spending will stall growth in establishments. But the number of enterprises is expected to rise modestly.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures electric and nonelectric household dishwashing equipment, dishwasher parts and other related components. Other household appliances are not included.

positive_impact_factors: high - steady barriers to entry level

key_trends: The industry relies on high per capita disposable income levels
R&D initiatives boost employment by attracting engineers and designers to the industry
Companies that have offshored their operations have entered the domestic market with high-quality imports
Industry operators will continue to focus on research and development
The trend toward domestic production is expected to continue
Consumers are not expected to rush to replace or buy new dishwashers
Profit has suffered during the period amid soaring input prices

market_segmentation.segment_description: Residential property is the largest market for the Dishwasher Manufacturing industry, representing 49.6% of industry revenue in 2022.
Nonresidential property is expected to comprise the second-largest share of industry revenue, generating 39.2% of sales in 2022.
Exports are expected to generate 11.2% of the total market for domestically manufactured dishwashers.

products_and_services.product_description: Dishwashers with Wi-Fi capability are able to connect to user devices, which enables consumers to control dishwashers with smart phones or voice commands.
While dishwasher manufacturers have innovated and developed new types of dishwashers, traditional built-in dishwashers still make up the largest category.
Compact dishwashers represent a small portion of the Dishwasher Manufacturing industry.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Dishwashers are costly appliances, so demand for dishwashers is low among households with low disposable income levels.
Demand for dishwashers is also affected by concern for the environment.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Over the five years to 2022, exports are expected to decline.
Imports of dishwashers and dishwasher components for consumption are expected to increase.

regulations_points.regulation_description: This law establishes stricter federal energy-efficiency standards for residential dishwashers.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is mature, indicating high barriers to entry.
The industry has a high level of market concentration.
The competition level in the industry is high and steady.

basis_points.basis_description: Companies compete based on their reputation in the market.
Companies compete by offering dishwashers with various features.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The three largest companies are expected to account for about 75% of industry revenue in 2022.
The industry has historically moved towards consolidation.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: A sharp increase in the world price of steel in 2021.
Purchases include the acquisition of raw materials used in the production.
Other input materials purchased by industry companies.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: This industry has a low level of capital intensity.
An abundance of skilled labor is required for research and development.
Over the past five years, capital intensity has risen slightly.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue is affected by macroeconomic factors.
Revenue is highly correlated with the value of new residential construction.
Industry revenue is also affected by imports.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The most significant technological development has been the growing use of Wi-Fi capabilities.
Smart dishwashers are able to connect to Wi-Fi.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Rising imports compete with industry products on a cost basis.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche or do you produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: There is little differentiation between dishwashers.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Input prices for metals such as steel have fluctuated historically.

FAQs.question: Have you looked into setting up manufacturing facilities in lower-wage regions of the country?
FAQs.answer: Outsourcing manufacturing operations to low-cost countries has been a sustained threat.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new technology?
FAQs.answer: "Smart" and connected dishwashers are a growing product segment.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through automation over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Automation has helped to curb manufacturing-related wage expenses.

FAQs.question: How does your company stay ahead of regulations, such as energy-efficiency standards?
FAQs.answer: Participation in industry assistance groups keeps operators aware.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Operators must ensure all of their manufacturing employees wear proper equipment.

FAQs.question: How has input price volatility affected profit margins over the past 12 months?
FAQs.answer: Volatile input prices have constrained profit margin growth.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your customers renew their orders?
FAQs.answer: Due to low product specialization, not many customers renew their contracts.

FAQs.question: How do you stay ahead of environmental regulations?
FAQs.answer: Dishwasher manufacturers must produce dishwashers that comply.

FAQs.question: Have you had issues with compliance in the past?
Are you located close to your largest markets? How else can you reduce transportation costs?
FAQs.answer: Many dishwasher manufacturers are based in areas where they can easily ship.

FAQs.question: How do you compete with high-profile competitors?
FAQs.answer: In the dishwasher market, brand recognition is crucial.

FAQs.question: How much of your revenue comes from residential upgrades and repairs? How do you project private spending on home improvements to trend in the future?
FAQs.answer: Since demand for dishwashers is primarily derived from residential construction.

FAQs.question: How do you price your appliances? Do you experience decreased demand when the price of household appliances increases?
How much of your demand comes from new residential construction? How will you respond to an increase in the number of housing starts?
FAQs.answer: The rate of housing starts reflects the level of new residential construction.
